intro: Cyrtandra × fruticosa, commonly known as the hybrid piper, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
